author: National Bureau
text:
BJP leader Subramanian Swamy wants the government to approach the Supreme Court seeking a day-to-day hearing of the pending civil appeals on the ownership of the disputed site in Ayodhya where the Babri mosque once stood.

The appeals are against the verdict of the Allahabad HC on the Ayodhya title suit. “I feel that it is appropriate that our government, especially its Law Officers, approach the Supreme Court with an application seeking day-to-day hearing on the Ram Janmabhoomi issues and pray that the Supreme Court gives its verdict on Civil Appeals as early as possible,” Dr. Swamy says in his letter to Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

The development comes at a time when the VHP has also been making a pitch for expediting the process for the construction of a Ram temple in Ayodhya.
title: Swamy writes to PM on Ram temple case
